titleStmt.title: Herman Hadlan v. D.M Brown. Writ

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Herman Hadlan v. D.M. Brown. Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the District Court of the Second Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding terms at Olympia
In the matter of the application of Herman Hadlan for a writ of Habeas Corpus

Upon reading and filing the petition of Herman Hadlan duly signed and verified by him, whereby it appears that he is illegally imprisoned and restrained of his liberty by D.M. Brown Marshall of the City of Olympia County of Thurston Territory of Washington and stating wherein the alleged illegality consists from which it appears to me that a Writ of Habeas Corpus ought to issue, it is ordered that a writ of Habeas Corpus issue out of and under the seal of the District Court of the Second Judicial District of Washington Territory holding terms at Olympia directed to the said D.M. Brown, Marshall as aforesaid commanding him to have the body of the said Herman Hadlan before me in the Court room of said Court at the City of Olympia County of Thurston Territory of Washington on the 2nd day of July AD 1884 at the hour of three o'clock P.M. of said day, to do and receive what shall then and there by considered concerning the said petitioner Herman Hadlan, together with the time and cause of his detention and that you have then and there the said writ.
Dated July 2nd 1884 John P. Hoyt Judge of said Court
